definition:
[*Binomial equation*]{} is an algebraic equation of the $$x^n-a = 0$$
where $n$ is a positive integer, $a$ belongs to a certain field (or
sometimes to a certain ring) and $x$ is the unknown (or the
indeterminate) of the equation. Solving the binomial equation means
taking the of $a$.

The binomial equation is written also $$x^n = a.$$ Such a binomial
equation may be examined in a group, too.

A special case of the binomial equation is the [*cyclotomic equation*]{}
$$x^n-1 = 0.$$ This name comes from the fact that the of the equation
the unit circle in the complex plane into $n$ equally long arcs (Greek
$\varkappa\acute{\upsilon}\varkappa\lambda{o}\varsigma$ ‘circle’,
$\tau\acute{o}\mu{o}\varsigma$ ‘part’).
